content:
Diagnosis:
Metastatic bladder cancer with squamous differentiation
T4bN2M1 with liver and bone metastases
PD-L1 TPS 5%

Trial Status:
Cycle 4 KEYNOTE-866 trial (Pembrolizumab + Gemcitabine/Cisplatin vs Placebo + Gemcitabine/Cisplatin)

Previous Treatment:
Cycle 1-3 completed with one dose delay due to neutropenia
Prophylactic GCSF support initiated from cycle 2

Current Status:
Stable disease on latest CT (15/04/2024)
CA19-9 trending down from 450 to 280
ECOG PS 1

Treatment Toxicity:
Grade 2 fatigue
Grade 1 peripheral neuropathy
Resolved neutropenia

Clinical Assessment:
Reviewed pre-cycle 4 trial therapy. Stable disease confirmed on protocol-mandated imaging. Main symptoms are fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips only. Performance status maintained at ECOG 1. Blood results show adequate renal function with eGFR 68, normal liver function, and adequate haematological parameters for treatment. Trial-specific quality of life questionnaires completed. Protocol-mandated ECG shows no changes.

Plan:
Proceed with cycle 4 trial treatment today
Continue GCSF prophylaxis
Protocol-mandated CT scan after cycle 6
Trial follow-up visit in 3 weeks

cancer_timeline.value: Started KEYNOTE-866 trial (Pembrolizumab + Gemcitabine/Cisplatin vs Placebo + Gemcitabine/Cisplatin)
Dose delay during cycles 1-3 due to neutropenia, GCSF prophylaxis initiated from cycle 2

patient_facts.value: eGFR 68, normal liver function, adequate haematological parameters

status_updates.value: Metastatic bladder cancer with squamous differentiation showing stable disease on KEYNOTE-866 trial treatment. Maintaining PS1 with manageable toxicities.
Stable disease on CT imaging with decreasing CA19-9
Grade 2 fatigue and Grade 1 peripheral neuropathy, previous neutropenia resolved
Proceeding with cycle 4 trial treatment with continued GCSF prophylaxis
